Initialize default style guide attributes

Source: R/initialize.R
default_style_guide_attributes.Rd

This function initializes and removes various variables from the parse table.

default_style_guide_attributes(pd_flat)

Arguments

pd_flat

A parse table.

Examples

string_to_format <- "call( 3)"
pd <- styler:::compute_parse_data_nested(string_to_format)
styler:::pre_visit(pd, c(default_style_guide_attributes))
#> # A tibble: 1 x 15
#>   pos_id token terminal text  short token_before token_after internal child
#>    <int> <chr> <lgl>    <chr> <chr> <chr>        <chr>       <lgl>    <lis>
#> 1      1 expr  FALSE    ""    ""    <NA>         <NA>        TRUE     <tib…
#> # ... with 6 more variables: newlines <int>, lag_newlines <int>, spaces <int>,
#> #   multi_line <lgl>, indention_ref_pos_id <lgl>, indent <dbl>
